intro: Erodium praecox var. jahandiezii, commonly known as the Persian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, pinkish to reddish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has hairy leaves and stems, which help reduce water loss in its native habitat. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral structure and limited geographic distribution.
